meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dirty or messy.
meanings.sent1: The muckiness of the room made it hard to find anything.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the children's clothes were covered in muckiness.
meanings.sent3: The muckiness of the spilled milk on the floor was not a pleasant sight.
meanings.sent4: The muckiness of the situation left everyone feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The muckiness of the mud after the rain was impossible to avoid.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or unpleasantness.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide her muckiness towards the slimy texture of the food.
meanings.sent2: The muckiness in his expression showed his distaste for the idea.
meanings.sent3: The muckiness she felt towards the creepy crawly bug was evident in her reaction.
meanings.sent4: The muckiness in the air made her want to leave the room immediately.
meanings.sent5: The muckiness in her tone revealed her strong aversion to the topic.

meanings.definition: The presence of muck or dirt.
meanings.sent1: The muckiness on his shoes indicated he had been working outside.
meanings.sent2: The muckiness on the car windshield made it hard to see through.
meanings.sent3: The muckiness on the dog's fur showed it had been rolling in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The muckiness on the windows made the whole house look unkempt.
meanings.sent5: The muckiness on the playground equipment made it clear it needed cleaning.
